developers.developer: I started developing Epsilon in 2004 and have been leading the project ever since. Most of my effort goes into the development and maintenance of EOL, ETL, EVL, ECL, EML, EWL, Eugenia, and the ANT workflow, as well as the release engineering activities of the project. I currently pretend to work as a lecturer in the Department of Computer Science of the University of York, one of the most research-intensive CS departments in the UK. I am currently recruiting PhD students so if the prospect of contributing mind-blowing features to future versions of Epsilon sounds like chocolate-covered unicorns - and you don't mind the ducks - do get in touch.
